skillTree.localised_description: Furtive, scheming, sly, cunning, underhand, devious, conniving, double-dealing, and sneaky - valuable traits if you wish to stay alive!
All Skaven are unprincipled and untrustworthy by their foul natures. However, this is rarely a disadvantage in the face of the enemy.
Slipping from covering and darting towards his foes, Veskit throws all the weight of his charge behind the shots coming from the weapons surgically attached to his hands.
The energy of Skaven spellcasting excites Veskit, making him even more thrilled to be in combat.

ui_effects.localised_text: Triggers when a friendly spell is active.

skillTree.localised_description: One too many Wyrdstone infusions have made Veskit volatile indeed, allowing him to spontaneously discharge destructive magical vortices.

ui_effects.localised_text: Enemies hit by vortex in melee combat

skillTree.localised_description: Sending Wyrdstone energies coursing through his system causes damage and fries some electronic components, but supercharges his ability to move and fight.

Lenses flick back and forth across Veskit's eye, always ensuring that he knows exactly when and where his prey will move. Those caught within range of these strange optics have little choice but to fight or flee, for they cannot hide.

attributes.bullet_text:
This unit is permanently visible to the enemy, regardless of line of sight.
	
	Revealed units are not affected by the following attributes:
	 Hide Forest
	 Stalk
	 Unspottable

skillTree.localised_description: Loose threads of arcane power are siphoned away from enemy spellcasters and fed into a Clan Skryre-designed device on his back that pumps restorative juice through his form.

ui_effects.localised_text: Triggers when an enemy spell is active.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit remains hidden while firing.
If this unit can hide at its current location it will not be spotted until the enemy is very close.

skillTree.localised_description: So much of war is an art. Over time and with much practice, combat moves can resemble a series of perfectly-rehearsed dance moves.
This being fights dirty, no honour system applies here!
"Stay in one place, gods-damn you!"
Whether a targeted slice to the throat, or a precision stab to the heart, this one knows how to kill!
"The enemy's fear; their blood spilt in the mud – these are the things that sustain me."
Those who are fleet of foot can reach the enemy faster.
Always on the lookout for an opening or advantage in battle - somewhere to put the knife in…
The harder they hit, the more they commit, the easier it is to strike back.
A drawn blade should not be put away until slaked in blood.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: Death is always just a shot away.
A Warpstone-enchanted breastplate and a thick steel helmet are useful to protect the wearer from shrapnel.
This blade is attached to a Warp-generator that channels crackling energy along the weapon.
By its very nature, being good at killing requires that you are equally adept at not dying.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +15% chance of wounding aggressors

Enemy Hero action success chance: -15%
	(enemy characters in region)

skillTree.localised_description: Those in the army can find succour or be replenished by the power of this champion.

effects.description: Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 3%
Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 6%
Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 9%

skillTree.localised_description: The sight of this warrior, their stature, import or infamy, can have a calming effect.

effects.description: Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 1
Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 2
Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 3

skillTree.localised_description: "If they know I'm coming then more's the better!"

effects.description: Assault Garrison action: Additional 5% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 30% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: A skilled assassin is a cold-hearted killer and merciless murderer.
Lying in wait, experienced and patient, striking when the foe least expects.

effects.description: Assault Units action: Additional 3% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 8% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
This unit can move hidden in any terrain.
Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

items.colour_text: The Cyberrat Suit is a grotesque amalgamation of mechanical components interwoven throughout Veskit's flesh. Gleaming plates of enchanted metal, etched with intricate sigils and infused with the corrupting influence of warpstone form a formidable barrier against harm. Upon activation, the Cyberrat Suit crackles with eldritch energy, emanating an aura of dark power that swirls around Veskit like a malevolent mist.

ui_effects.localised_text: Triggers when a friendly or enemy spell is active.

items.colour_text:
At first glance, the Rocketclaw appears as a grotesque melding of metal and flesh, with sinewy cables and pulsating tubes snaking across Veskit's arm. Gleaming metal plates, etched with arcane symbols and adorned with warpstone-infused runes, encase his hands, serving as the launching platforms for the deadly projectiles.
	
	Upon activation, the Rocketclaw hums to life with a malevolent energy, vents hissing steam as it readies its payload. With a twitch of Veskit's augmented fingers, the Rocketclaw unleashes its deadly arsenal—a salvo of rockets propelled by volatile warpstone fuel, streaking towards their targets with lethal precision.
	
	But the true horror of the Rocketclaw lies not only in its destructive power but also in its relentless efficiency. Mounted with sophisticated targeting mechanisms and guided by Veskit's unnaturally enhanced reflexes, the Rocketclaw ensures that no prey can escape its wrath. With a single gesture, Veskit can rain down death upon his enemies from afar, turning the darkened streets of Mordheim into a battlefield where none dare to tread.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Veskit was already a talented Skaven Eshin Assassin when he was entrusted with his most difficult mission. He was hired by Clan Skryre to free one of their oldest and most experienced Warlock-Engineers who was being held hostage by a rival clan. Veskit managed to take the prisoner back, fighting his way through the guards, but at a very high cost. He suffered terrible wounds and would have certainly died, but the ruling Nightmaster of Clan Eshin made a pact with the Warlock-Engineers. Those Skaven scientist-sorcerers replaced various parts of Veskit's body with their part-technological, part-magical implants and made him into a walking arsenal of deadly weapons. When news of the warpstone that struck the city of Mordheim came to the hidden fortress of Clan Eshin, the Nightmaster sent Veskit to the ruined Human city to deter the man-things from exploring Mordheim's remains, which rightfully belonged to the Skaven.

enabled_if: No friendly units in ability range.

attributes.bullet_text: Entities with this attribute double their charge bonus when attacking the rear or flank of an entity.
This unit takes no penalties when flanked.
